p: The methanol/water (1:5, v/ v) solvent was selected as the stationary phase of the polarity-stepwise elution CCC, since the settling times and phase ratios (upper phase to lower phase) of the newly paired solvent systems composed of the stationary phase, methanol/water (1:5, v/ v), and individual mobile phases with polarities from low to high ( Table 2), were within the range of the recommended values: their settling times were less than 30 s, and the phase ratios were close to 1 ( Table 2). A short settling time usually facilitates the retention of the stationary phase in the HSCCC column and a rapid settling time is recommended to be shorter than 30 s [ 17]. That the phase ratios of each newly paired solvent system were close to 1 might help maintain the retention of the stationary phase. Thus, all the solvents shown in Table 2 are acceptable as alternative mobile phases for the stepwise elution CCC separation.
